🌍 MARKET NEWS RECAP

USA markets saw a marginal pullback on Friday in holiday-thinned trading, with the $SPX closing down less than 0.1% at 6,929.94 and the $NDAQ slipping 0.1% as investors took profits following recent record highs. Precious metals, however, extended their year-long rally, with Gold and Silver surging to fresh all-time highs on geopolitical uncertainty and expectations of further Fed rate cuts. Meanwhile, the Shanghai Composite in China edged up 0.1% to 3,963.68, while most major European indices, including the Euro Stoxx, were closed for the Christmas holiday.

**🌍 MARKET OVERVIEW**
Asian markets were mixed in quiet trading, though China's $Shanghai Composite posted a modest gain of 0.3% despite rising geopolitical tensions related to military drills near Taiwan. European stock futures are pointing slightly higher as the region resumes trading for a shortened holiday week, with the $Euro Stoxx 50 expected to open with a positive bias. US equity futures are largely flat in thin pre-market trade, following the previous week's record highs. In commodities, crude oil advanced, with Brent crude topping $60 per barrel, while silver continued its recent rally with a 3% jump.

USA markets are poised for a quiet open with $S&P 500 futures little changed and $NDAQ 100 futures slipping 0.2% in holiday-thinned trading following last week's rally. Asian equities were mixed, but China's $Shanghai Composite posted a modest gain of 0.4% as year-end flows continued. European stock futures point to a slightly higher open, with $Euro Stoxx 50 futures up 0.3%. The commodity sector saw dramatic movement as silver surged to a new all-time high, while gold pulled back more than 1% after reaching a fresh peak in the prior session.

💼 PORTFOLIO FOCUS
